title: Binance Controlled 92% of Bitcoin Spot Trading Volume at End of 2022: Arcane Research - Yahoo Finance
content:
The world’s largest crypto exchange, Binance’s market share of bitcoin (BTC) trading volume rose to 92% by the end of 2022, according to Arcane Research.

The exchange’s market share was just 45% at the start of last year, but the elimination of trading fees in June, not to mention the collapse of rival FTX in November, served to push users to Binance.

“No matter how you look at it in terms of trading activity, Binance is the crypto market,” Arcane wrote. “After lifting trading fees for its BTC spot pairs this summer, Binance completely overtook all market share in the spot market.”

Binance dominance in crypto spot and derivatives Market Research Jan 3, 2023 Binance Dominance (Source: Arcane Research)

While Binance has been by far the biggest crypto exchange by trading volume for several years, these and other numbers suggest monopoly-like dominance. A report from CryptoCompare showed Binance’s overall year-end crypto market share was 66.7%. Coinbase (COIN) came in second with a relatively tiny 8.2%.

“Retail crypto could enter a dark age that takes forever to exit” should Binance fail, said Edward Moya, senior analyst at Oanda. “Binance is too big … It is not healthy to have so much of the trading volume concentrated with any one exchange.”

Chatter about the solvency of Binance increased significantly after the collapse of FTX, and the exchange did suffer some outflows for a short period, though things have stabilized since. A market share this high could become problematic for the industry if Binance were to encounter any issues, whether regulatory or mistrust from users.

Binance is currently under investigation by the U.S. Justice Department over compliance with anti-money laundering laws and sanctions. The exchange also recently lost its auditor, Mazars Group, which announced a pause in its work with crypto exchanges looking to produce proof-of-reserves.

New Delhi: The cryptocurrency market continued to move higher on Wednesday as buying was seen across all major cryptocurrencies. Bitcoin celebrated a calm 14th birthday as it hovered around the $16,864 mark, which is a jump of 0.74% from the previous day. Solana continued its mega rally as it surged by over 17% fuelled by positive sentiments around the coin."The market has started 2023 on a positive note and it is expected to sustain this momentum if we don’t get any surprising news headlines," Shivam Thakral, CEO of BuyUcoin said.Most of the other top crypto tokens were also trading higher on Wednesday.Cardano gained 3.78%. Ethereum , Binance, Dogecoin, Polygon and Litecoin were also trading higher. However, Tether, XRP and Tron were trading lower.The global cryptocurrency market cap was trading higher around $818.75 billion, rising 1.22% in the last 24 hours.The total volume in DeFi is currently $2.12 billion, around 6.89% of the total crypto market 24-hour volume. The volume of all stablecoins is now $28.37 billion, which is 92.24% of the total crypto market 24-hour volume.The market cap of Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, hovered around $324 billion, with a dominance of about 39.63%, a decrease of 0.23% over the day, according to CoinMarketCap."Looking at the historical growth of Bitcoin, we find that it has thrived victoriously through multiple bull and bear market cycles. According to data from Glassnodes, close to 60% of circulating Bitcoin hasn't moved in a year. This shows that the trust in the asset remains rock solid. We are confident that Bitcoin will continue to emerge victorious and see greater heights in future," Raj Karkara, COO of ZebPay said.Banks should be more careful about the risks of fraud, legal uncertainty and misleading disclosures by crypto firms, U.S. regulators warned on Tuesday, just two months after the collapse of crypto exchange FTX stunned the financial world.In their first joint statement on crypto, the Federal Reserve, Federal Deposit Insurance Corp (FDIC) and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) said they had concerns with the safety and soundness of bank business models that are highly concentrated in crypto.Crypto Cart: Quick Glance (Source: coinmarketcap.com , data as of 12.01 hours, IST on January 04, 2023)(Note: Price change in last 24 hours)

title: Watch The Outlook for Bitcoin in 2023 - Bloomberg
content:
00:00

What do you think about the situation, especially in the last two months, essentially, that we find Bitcoin in, it hasn't budged since like November 8th, stuck around sixteen thousand and change. Why this incredible lack of volatility? This is true, but I'm just looking at the graph. You know, the big graph. Abigail, your correspondent, was showing just before the break, it was it was really fascinating when you look at it on that big scale like that, because you see what we've been pointing out for years and years, which is that you get these big trends with crept up and down and up and down these big waves that last for a few years and then back down and then another one and another one. And you know, we can't go on forever and ever. Right. We're not gonna be sitting here in hundreds of years time with with the same kind of pattern of waves. But it has held firm really well so far and is reflected in a really interesting report I read from the man group just before Christmas, which showed that a trend following strategy performed on Bitcoin and a theorem has outperformed buy and hold. It's been extremely effective. Really? That's what I've been doing for years and years. I buy as each new trend begins. And then once there's all the froth. And you always know when you're at the frothy time because everybody is going crazy about crypto. And that's the time I always start to think about selling. And, you know, so far that has worked several times in a row, as I say. You can't be sure that it will continue to work forever. But so far, always the waves. OK. So once we get out of this period of status, is it more likely we get a break to the up or downside, in your view? Glenn? Well, look, we can't definitively say that we've had the very last bit of downward movement, certainly loads of old chain data and and the various indicators that we use to try and see where we are in a cycle are telling us that we are pretty much at the bottom. But I know from past experience that even when the indicators tell you you're at the bottom, you might get one more lurch downwards. I mean, we've got a huge lurch downwards. You might remember, in 2020, just before the bull market began, because the pandemic caused everybody to panic and everybody rushed out of stocks and crypto. But then they rushed back into crypto in the big, big bull market began. So, yeah, as I say, you can't rule out another lurch downwards. But as I say, as a trend follower, I tend to wait until I see, you know, really clear signs that we're back at the beginning of an upward trend. For example, my personal account, I didn't really start buying until we got to about ten thousand dollars. And in 2020, the price had previously gone as low as I think about what was it, three or four thousand dollars? So I waited quite a while. I missed quite a lot of upside, but gotten with plenty more upside to go, of course. Glenn, what do you refer to? They they were rushing out and then rushing back into crypto. Who realistically are we talking about or are we talking about retail or are we talking about institutions? Is there still institutional buy in after all of the turmoil we have seen? There's no love of institutional buying right now, but I can pretty much guarantee that there will be again, simply because it's on their menu now. It's on their radar. And the report that I mentioned from Man Group here, of course, is huge asset manager was was very positive about the idea of crypto as an asset class. And the report even suggested actually that if you don't invest in crypto in the longer term, then you are in a sense exposed to it in a negative way. Because companies that you are exposed to might be pushed out of the market eventually by crypto will block chain based competitors. So, you know, that report was suggesting that that you kind of need to have exposure. I hope I'm not paraphrasing them too much, but that was what I took from it. Glenn, is it important to get regulation, you know, for for crypto or Bitcoin specifically because this crypto currency, it felt like was invented to circumvent that kind of centralized government control? Like, do we even want it? I want to see a lot more skepticism generally during the bull phase. I mean, we're never short of skepticism during the bad phases. But some people like the next guy that you've got coming on, Stephen Dale, who is kind of shouting about the negatives during the bull market. Nobody was listening to him then. They're all listening to him now, of course. But it's too late for that during the bull phases. We need people to look at things like Luna when you have 20 percent yields being offered on people's money. You know, I was looking at that at the time. People were asking me about it and I was thinking about something very suspicious. I don't know if there's a problem with the code, but 20 percent yield, you know, if it's in traditional finance, you would start asking serious questions. And the same needs to happen in crypto. People just shouldn't get too overexcited on the upside.
